result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis A. Spitzer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: No contact with victim unless approved by agent;

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis A. Spitzer

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on November 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:37 p.m. 
Clerk Micki.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence and DOC Agent; Defendant appears in person, with Attorney Vanessa Avila.

Date and time set for a Probation Review Hearing. VRCW.

COURT questions defendant if he has received a copy of the probation review; Defendant in receipt of report and reviewed same;
Defendant makes statement. 
Agent makes statement. 
Atty Avila makes statement. 

NEXT DATE:  PRH - 11/11/22 at 1:15 p.m.

Adj: 1:41 p.m.
Probation Status Review dated 9-15-22
Probation Status Review dated 9-13-22
Probation review hearing on September 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

2:41 p.m.
Clerk Micki.

State appears by DDA Molly Lawrence; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Vanessa Avila.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to: 
COUNT 1:  Disorderly Conduct, Repeater, Domestic Abuse >> GUILTY.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; SAFE Program; N/C with victim unless approved by agent; CC; DV surcharge; DNA sample and surcharge; probation review hearings; I/S 30 days MCJ for rule violations; I/S 30 hours CS for rule violations; 2 days jail credit; and no objection to early discharge from probation if all programming is complete and at the agent's approval. 

NEXT DATES>>
Probation Review Hearing - 9/16/22 at 1:15p.m. 

Adj: 2:55 p.m.

No contact with victim(s):  N.E.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retreive personal property from the residence.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release.
